articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Syria 
    Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's famous work "Let Us Uphold Independence" was published in booklet on July 6 by the Dar Dimashk Publishing House of Syria.
 The work, brought out on September 7, Juche 70 (1981), clarified the strategy of the anti-imperialist struggle that calls for vigorously waging a revolutionary struggle against the U.S. imperialism on the basis of a scientific analysis of the international situation and indicated the way for those countries which won national independence to maintain political independence and build independent national economy.

articles.content:
Floral Baskets Sent to DPRK Embassies 
    Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The president of the Cuban Institute of Friendship with the Peoples and the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) sent floral baskets to the DPRK embassies in their countries on July 8 on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
 Meanwhile, the director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, the chairman of the Juche Philosophy Study Committee of India, the president of the Indian Working Women Society for the Study of the Juche Philosophy, the chairman of the Indian Intellectuals' Juche Idea Study Society, the secretary general of the All-India Veterans Federation, the principal of Minaba Bharata International School, and other Indian personages visited the DPRK embassy in New Delhi to lay floral baskets before the portrait of Kim Il Sung and pay homage to him.

articles.title: Functions Held at DPRK Consulate General in Shenyang
articles.content:
S. Korean Christians Demand Withdrawal of Decision on Troopï¿½@Dispatch 
    Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Council of Christian Churches reportedly sponsored a prayer meeting for peace and demonstration of Christians demanding withdrawal of the decision on the troop dispatch to Iraq in Jongro, Seoul, on July 9.
 The participants shouted slogans "Withdraw troop dispatch", "No war" and so on, carrying placards denouncing the GIs' brutal murderous atrocities in Iraq and condemning Bush.    
 Kim Jin Ho, director general of the Christian Solidarity for Peace in Iraq, stressed that churches should join in the activities for repealing the authorities' decision on the troop dispatch to Iraq.

articles.title: Lecture Sponsored by Chongryon
Kim Il Chol Meets Director of CPLA General Logistics Department
articles.content:
Lecture Sponsored by Chongryon 
    Tokyo, July 13 (KNS-KCNA) -- A lecture was sponsored by the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on July 12 on the occasion of the tenth anniversary of the demise of President
Kim Il Sung.
 Present there were Chief Vice-Chairman Ho Jong Man, Vice-Chairmen Nam Sung U, Ryang Su Jong, Ri Ki Sok and Ko Tok U, Director General of the Secretariat Pae Jin Gu of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon and other officials of Chongryon..    
 The participants listened to a tape-recorded lecture "The Great President
Kim Il Sung Will Always Be with Us Compatriots in Japan."

articles.title: Wu Bangguo Meets DPRK Military Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Il Chol Meets Director of CPLA General Logistics Department
    Beijing, July 13 (KCNA) -- Vice-Marshal Kim Il Chol, member of the National Defence Commission and minister of the People's Armed Forces of the DPRK, on a visit to the People's Republic of China met and had a friendly talk with Colonel General Liao Xilong, Director of the General Logistics Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, on July 13.
 Present there were the members of the DPRK military delegation, the military attache of the DPRK embassy in Beijing, deputy directors of the General Logistics Department of the CPLA and the military attache of the Chinese embassy in Pyongyang.
